name: Churchill Downs Incorporated
description: Churchill Downs Incorporated (CDI) is a leading horse racing and gaming company, best known for owning and operating the iconic Churchill Downs Racetrack in Louisville, Kentucky, which hosts the world-famous Kentucky Derby. Founded in 1875, CDI has a rich history in the horse racing industry, expanding its operations to include a diverse portfolio of racetracks, casinos, and online gaming platforms. The company operates multiple racetracks across the United States, including the Fair Grounds Race Course in New Orleans and Arlington International Racecourse in Illinois, while also engaging in gaming through its casinos and online wagering services. CDI is committed to enhancing the horse racing experience for fans and participants alike, focusing on safety, integrity, and innovation. In recent years, the company has embraced technology, launching advanced wagering platforms that cater to both in-person and online customers. CDI's mission is to provide world-class entertainment and gaming experiences while preserving the traditions of horse racing. With a focus on growth and sustainability, Churchill Downs continues to explore new opportunities in the gaming and entertainment sectors, including partnerships and expansions that align with its core values.
